titles.title: A resolution expressing the sense of the Senate that the Olympic Summer Games in the year 2000 should not be held in Beijing or elsewhere in the People's Republic of China.

action.text: Sponsor introductory remarks on measure. (CR S7634-7635)
Referred to the Committee on Commerce.
Star Print ordered on the resolution.
Sponsor introductory remarks on measure. (CR S11950-11951)

bill.summary: 6/22/1993--Introduced. Expresses opposition to holding the Olympic Summer Games in the year 2000 in the People's Republic of China. Urges the International Olympic Committee to find another, more suitable venue for the Games. Urges the U.S. Representative to the Committee to vote against holding the Games in China.
